parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From moros; to become insipid; figuratively, to make as a simpleton.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

word: can it be made salty again?
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hals; to salt.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
No one, none, nothing.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From kata and pateo; to trample down; figuratively, to reject with disdain.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
